update.description: This allows for the user to pass a world string into the ServerConfig. In this specific case, it is used to pass a world without physics into the network\_handshake integration test to circumvent some ODE issues with multiple physics systems per executable.
update.title: Add SetSdfString to ServerConfig.

content.raw:
I had that at some point, I think you may be using a version that is too modern, how did you install clang-tidy? This is my version now, which should match pipelines:

~~~
$ clang-6.0 --version
clang version 6.0.0-1ubuntu2 (tags/RELEASE_600/final)
~~~

I had that at some point, I think you may be using a version that is too modern, how did you install clang-tidy? This is my version now, which should match pipelines:

content.raw:
Yeah, I have clang-tidy-6.0, and I see the following repeated pattern for every component.

``
40652 warnings and 1 error generated.
Error while processing /data/ignition/ign-gazebo-prs/test/plugins/TestModelSystem.cc.
warning: dynamic exception specification '' is deprecated; consider using 'noexcept' instead [modernize-use-noexcept]
/data/ignition/ign-gazebo-prs/include/ignition/gazebo/EntityComponentManager.hh:514:26: warning: invalid case style for parameter 'iterator' [readability-identifier-naming]
          detail::View>::iterator &_iter) const;
                         ^~~~~~~~
                         _iterator
```
content.html:
Yeah, I have clang-tidy-6.0, and I see the following repeated pattern for every component.

`` 40652 warnings and 1 error generated. Error while processing /data/ignition/ign-gazebo-prs/test/plugins/TestModelSystem.cc. warning: dynamic exception specification '' is deprecated; consider using 'noexcept' instead [modernize-use-noexcept] /data/ignition/ign-gazebo-prs/include/ignition/gazebo/EntityComponentManager.hh:514:26: warning: invalid case style for parameter 'iterator' [readability-identifier-naming] detail::View>::iterator &_iter) const; ^~~~ _iterator ```

content.raw:
I think that the general guidance with “modern” c\+\+ is to use pass-by-value and move for constructors rather than const refs and copies because it can potentially drop a copy if the parameter is an rvalue. I linked that totw on the other PR, and that’s the gist of it.  
  
Edit: We don’t have to do that, but that’s where the clang-tidy warnings come from.  We can also disable the check, if you want \([https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize-pass-by-value.html](https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize-pass-by-value.html)\)
content.html:
I think that the general guidance with “modern” c++ is to use pass-by-value and move for constructors rather than const refs and copies because it can potentially drop a copy if the parameter is an rvalue. I linked that totw on the other PR, and that’s the gist of it.

Edit: We don’t have to do that, but that’s where the clang-tidy warnings come from. We can also disable the check, if you want (https://clang.llvm.org/extra/clang-tidy/checks/modernize-pass-by-value.html)

content.raw:
`clang-tidy-6.0` should be the correct version.

Are you using the script \([#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/tools/clang\_tidy.sh](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/tools/clang_tidy.sh)\) to run it? It has some additional suppressions/filters that are useful.
content.html:
clang-tidy-6.0 should be the correct version.

Are you using the script (#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/default/tools/clang_tidy.sh) to run it? It has some additional suppressions/filters that are useful.
